source.name: Cross-Chain Token Transfers in DAOs
source.instructions: Which of the following scenarios *best* demonstrates a practical application of cross-chain token transfers in a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO)?

answers.answer: A DAO votes on Ethereum to allocate funds from its treasury  to a new project on Polygon
DAO members use multiple wallets on different chains to participate in a single governance vote
A DAO conducts off-chain voting to decide on token distribution on the DAO's blockchain
The DAO's smart contract automatically rebalances its token holding portfolio on Avalanche daily
DAO members can view the organization's token balances on multiple chains through a single interface

source.guidance:
The correct answer is "A DAO votes on Ethereum to allocate funds from its treasury  to a new project on Polygon" .This scenario demonstrates a practical application of cross-chain token transfers in a DAO context. It involves a governance decision on one chain (Ethereum) that results in the movement of funds on another chain (Polygon), showcasing true cross-chain interoperability and token transfer. 

The other options, while may relate to multi-chain operations, do not specifically demonstrate cross-chain token transfers: using multiple wallets for voting, off-chain voting for single-chain token distribution, automatic rebalancing on a single chain, and viewing balances across chains don't involve the transfer of tokens between different blockchains as a result of a governance decision.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT analyze and evaluate scenarios involving cross-chain token transfers in DAOs
